jurisdiction.title: Roman Catholic Diocese of Joliet Illinois

9B969FC0193246AD93E648047D77764A.description:
Explain how laws and government
policies affecting the economy establish
rules to help a market economy
function effectively.

83295B61789C4D2D814EF6EFD7B81B2E.description:
Identify the main sources of revenue for
federal and state governments.

8A676F22120D41AA9EACD30F69CF2669.description:
Analyze the benefits and costs to
individuals and businesses when they
operated to protect the poor and
vulnerable.

BF782A2827E64E42BFA0CD9E04E64CE5.description:
Analyze the benefits and costs to
individuals and businesses of
government policies that affect the
economy.

5935EC59BDC54AF0AC1C41A134904A0C.description:
Identify examples of proportional,
progressive, and regressive taxes in the
economy; evaluate fairness of each tax.

B89AD2C21684489AABED7357BA6CA74D.description: Understand the impact of government policies and decisions on production and consumption in the economy. Understand the moral implications of policies and decisions on production and consumption. Explain how one’s beliefs about God, about humanity, and about material things, affect one’s actions. CSIS7 (K-6 CS)       Demonstrate the ways men and societies change and/or persist over time to better understand the human condition. CSIS8 (7&8)

09EEDFFE51E64C488089A7D2F764F3B2.description:
Identify new technologies over time
and explain their impact on the
economy.

3872EC9B7AF3400C8CEE1144CD11FBD8.description:
Analyze materialism in relation to
social justice. Evaluate trade and
mutual benefits.

3C3523C88A884C079524E5F8341EB6CB.description:
Explain how people’s incomes reflect
choices they have made about
education, training, skill development,
and careers.

ACDB03DB5AA74428B63E7ED24144477B.description:
Analyze the impact of an increase or
decrease in imports/exports on jobs and
consumers in the U.S.

B0E671ADBE484538AB6577EB57487015.description:
Identify barriers to trade and their
impact, and explain why nations create
barriers to trade.

65B97000EF9447C2853C28912229BEDF.description:
Explain why comparative advantage
leads to specialization and trade.

04AB0E53C0CF4484984735D2F1CDD158.description:
Define and provide an example of
comparative advantage in the school or
community.

DD35AB51AF2F4679A165E279EE6FB479.description: Understanding trade as an exchange of goods or services. Understand moral values behind the understanding of trade as an exchange of goods and services. Explain how one’s beliefs about God, about humanity, and about material things, affect one’s actions. CSIS7       Value one’s own role and dignity as man in God’s plan and creation. CSGS5 (7&8)

DCF8FC526E43450A8FE4427D4E6253A8.description:
Explain why, as the market price of a
good or service goes up, the quantity
supplied also goes up.

FF58C0FEC2A042B1AAFD1DF759FE7556.description:
Provide examples of how the same
incentive will bring about differing
responses from differing people based
on their understanding of religious
teachings.

2E725FF31CE74898A64239EDC35996D1.description:
Provide examples of how changes in
incentives encourage people to change
their economic behavior in predictable
ways.

EAE555D127274561A89CE2D5B932F1E5.description:
Understand that scarcity necessitates choices by producers. Understand that scarcity necessitates producer choices which have moral implications. Explain how one’s beliefs about God, about humanity, and about material things, affect one’s actions. CSIS7       Value and develop a love for the common good and our shared humanity, not just with those around us, but for those who have gone before
and those who will come after us. CSDS2 (7-12 CS)

C0B88DCB875642F5B1311C12A3E3A1C4.description:
Analyze shortages and surpluses in
relation to our responsibility as
stewards of God’s creation.

6B46E5659DBA401F830A3A5D8EF0DEFB.description:
Explain why shortages and surpluses
occur in a market economy and provide
real-world examples of each.

3A1607650FEA415A87F581BCED633847.description:
Explain how prices help allocate scarce
goods and services in a market
economy.

22B31173E3C7487AB90854D313BD34D0.description:
Predict how the change in price of one
good or service can lead to changes in
prices of other goods and services.

1F7F9CCED0614D4D8061C3DF7C7FF5EF.description:
Explain why, as market price of a good
or service goes up, the quantity
demanded by consumers goes down.

B6658BFDC2784E8E99437B30C501AE8A.description:
Understand that scarcity necessitates choices by consumers. Understand that scarcity necessitates consumer choices which have moral implications. Discriminate between what is positive in the world, what needs to be transformed, and what injustices must be overcome. CSDS4
Explain how one’s beliefs about God, about humanity, and about material things, affect one’s actions. CSIS7

F885A17D6FE5439E8575AA0460A17F51.description:
Analyze the relationship between
productivity and wages based on the
Church’s teaching about dignity and
rights of the worker.

0EEACAE001BE4952AA5351E35F7428CD.description:
Describe the role of financial
institutions in the economy.

F66D86EBEF334A8A9F0D20C2B500C49E.description:
Demonstrate the circular flow of
interaction among households,
businesses and government in the
economy.

C9C72D0DE405499996668B237319A43D.description:
Analyze the relationship between
productivity and wages.

36D737D1519B48F4B2B0C3CED90165BB.description:
Explain how the price of productive
resources in a market economy would
influence producer decisions about
how, how much, and to what to
produce.

6535E1DECDEB4B148067C1A0DFA907F4.description:
Understand how different economic systems operate in exchange, production, distribution and consumption of goods and services. Understand the moral consequences of how different economic systems operate in exchange, production, distribution and consumption of goods and services. Identify the motivating values that have informed particular societies and how they correlate with Catholic teaching. CSIS7 (7-12 CS)
Explain how one’s beliefs about God, about humanity, and about material things, affect one’s actions .CSIS 7 (K-6 CS)
Distinguish the religious dimensions and basic elements of Christian social ethics within historical events. CSIS19 (7& 8)

AE797CCD53154EB297FB3CDBDA9E1B1C.description: Understand economic systems with an emphasis on the United States. Understand moral aspects of the economic systems of the United States.
